_comments._editing_guide: The fields below can be edited to customize the department page content. These texts will appear on the public website.
_comments._introText: Short introduction that appears at the top of the department page
_comments._descriptionText: Detailed description - you can use placeholder variables like {jurisdiction.name}, {department.name}, etc.
_comments._roleText: Description of the department's role and importance to the province
_comments._programsHeading: Heading for the programs and services section
_comments._programsDescription: Description of what programs and services this department offers

introText: The Ministry of Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade supports business growth, innovation, and international trade, working to strengthen Ontario's economy and create jobs.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade spent $1.3B in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 0.6% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports business development and innovation.
roleText: Economic growth and job creation are vital for Ontario's prosperity. This ministry supports businesses, promotes innovation, facilitates trade, and creates conditions for economic development across the province.
programsDescription: The Ministry of Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade operates programs including business investment incentives, innovation tax credits, trade promotion, regional development, and industrial land development.
